means: <英>（英国过去的货币，现已不用）四分之一便士
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 法辛绰号，付租金者，来源于中世纪英语、古英语，含义是“四分之一便士”(quarter of a penny)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 法辛地貌名称，分得的四分之一地块
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 法辛来源于古诺斯语人名，含义是“走+斗士，英雄”(to go+warrior,hero)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fēorthing, from fēortha 'fourth', perhaps on the pattern of Old Norse fjórthungr 'quarter'

entry.tran: 法寻(英国小硬币，面值为旧制便士的 1/4)
entry.def: A farthing was a small British coin which was worth a quarter of an old penny.

means.word_mean: 1. a former British bronze coin worth a quarter of a penny

auth_sentence.content: A certaine poore widow...threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A certaine poore widow...threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

auth_sentence.content: Nostalgia for a world...of Norfolk jackets, muttonchop whiskers, penny-farthing bicycles.

auth_sentence.content: About the New Year...every child had got its handsel, and every farthing of every handsel was spent there.
